verses.verse: Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, Keep<WH8104> ye justice<WH4941>, and do<WH6213> righteousness<WH6666>; for my salvation<WH3444> is near<WH7138> to come<WH935>, and my righteousness<WH6666> to be revealed<WH1540>.

Blessed <WH835> is the man<WH582> that doeth<WH6213> this<WH1121>, and the son of man<WH120> that holdeth<WH2388> it fast<WH8104>; that keepeth the sabbath<WH7676> from profaning<WH2490> it<WH8104>, and keepeth his hand<WH3027> from doing<WH6213> any evil<WH7451>.

Neither let the<WH1121> foreigner<WH5236>, that hath joined<WH3867> himself to Jehovah<WH3068>, speak<WH559>, saying<WH559>, Jehovah<WH3068> will surely<WH914> separate<WH914> me from his people<WH5971>; neither let the eunuch<WH5631> say<WH559>, Behold<WH3002>, I am a dry tree<WH6086>.
For thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068> of the eunuchs<WH5631> that keep<WH8104> my sabbaths<WH7676>, and choose<WH977> the things that please<WH2654> me<WH2388>, and hold fast my covenant<WH1285>:

Unto them will I give<WH5414> in my house<WH1004> and within my walls<WH2346> a memorial<WH3027> and a name<WH8034> better<WH2896> than of sons<WH1121> and of daughters<WH1323>; I will give<WH5414> them an everlasting<WH5769> name<WH8034>, that shall not be cut off<WH3772>.

Also the<WH1121> foreigners<WH5236> that join<WH3867> themselves to Jehovah<WH3068>, to minister<WH8334> unto him<WH157>, and to love the name<WH8034> of Jehovah<WH3068>, to be his servants<WH5650>, every one that keepeth<WH8104> the sabbath<WH7676> from profaning<WH2490> it<WH2388>, and holdeth fast my covenant<WH1285>;

even them will I bring<WH935> to my holy<WH6944> mountain<WH2022>, and make them joyful<WH8055> in my house<WH1004> of prayer<WH8605>: their burnt-offerings<WH5930> and their sacrifices<WH2077> shall be accepted<WH7522> upon mine altar<WH4196>; for my house<WH1004> shall be called<WH7121> a house<WH1004> of prayer<WH8605> for all peoples<WH5971>.
The Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH136>, who gathereth<WH6908> the outcasts<WH1760> of Israel<WH3478>, saith<WH5002>, Yet will I gather<WH6908> others to him<WH6908>, besides his own that are gathered.
All ye beasts<WH2416> of the field<WH7704>, come<WH857> to devour<WH398>, yea<WH2416>, all ye beasts in the forest<WH3293>.

His watchmen<WH6822> are blind<WH5787>, they are all without knowledge<WH3045>; they are all dumb<WH483> dogs<WH3611>, they cannot<WH3201> bark<WH5024>; dreaming<WH1957>, lying down<WH7901>, loving<WH157> to slumber<WH5123>.

Yea <WH3611>, the dogs are greedy<WH5794>, they can<WH3045> never have<WH3045> enough<WH7654>; and these are shepherds<WH7462> that cannot understand<WH995>: they have all turned<WH6437> to their own way<WH1870>, each one<WH376> to his gain<WH1215>, from every quarter<WH7097>.

Come <WH857> ye<WH3947>, say they, I will fetch wine<WH3196>, and we will fill<WH5433> ourselves with strong drink<WH7941>; and to-morrow<WH4279> shall be as this day<WH4279>, a day great<WH3966> beyond<WH3499> measure<WH1419>.
